reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you love to fall asleep with people screaming, laughing and talking right outside your balcony, than this is the hotel for you. We spent five sleepless nights pre cruise due to the lack of soundproofing of the balcony doors. Directly below the hotel are benches and chairs where people would congregate all night, sometimes until 5am. I would consider this a budget hotel offering few amenities. There are no toiletries, bar soap or kleenex. They provide a plastic bottle with a pump containing liquid soap. The beds in our room were board hard and the walls very thin. Our room shared a wall with the hostel next door and we had to call our desk several times to have them turn off the loud music playing at midnight. My husband finally started using ear plugs at night. In due respect to the hotel the rooms were kept very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. However, the free beer and wine and mediocre 24 hour buffet were not enticements for us. We would rather sit outside at one of the many tapas bars and enjoy a reasonably priced meal and sangria and watch the sites of La Rambla. Barcelona is a beautiful and vibrant city and we do look forward to returning. However, we value our sleep and prefer a quiet environment and therefore would definitely not stay at the Hotel Continental.
reviews.title: Sleepless on La Rambla

reviews.text: Hotel right on the Rambla with a great location. This hotel is a mixed bag. The rooms and hall were very small. The towels did not feel fresh and smelled soured. The beds were just O.K.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side they had a very nice breakfast and food was out all day. Staff was helpful to help with luggage due to very small elevator and cramped halls. I would probably stay again due to location and price,but it definitely could use an update.
reviews.title: Clean, comfy, safe, and a great location : )

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night after a week long Med cruise before catching a flight back to the States. The hotel was described pretty accurately by posts that we had read before booking the room, great location and very very pink.
reviews.title: I would avoid the Hotel Continental Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked in way in advance at a rate of 115E/night for a double room with a balcony. The balcony was nicer than expected and the views of La Rambla was as good as described! However, the same reviews did say that the noise of La Rambla was a bit loud, and I wasn't expecting for it to be THIS loud. We ended up going to bed at 2:30am and it was still a party atmosphere outside. Actually, it never stopped, people were still going at it when we awoke at 7. So for the first time in my life, I slept with earplugs. My advice is to either bring earplugs, or do not book a balcony room if you are concerned about being able to sleep with all of the street noise of people shouting. We could not figure out how to turn on the AC (may have been off for the season?) so we had to sleep with the balcony door open. Being able to close it may have made a huge difference, not sure though.
reviews.title: In the thick of it
Wonderful Location and Two Great Stays
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Continental Baecelona for three nights pre-cruise and two nights post cruise (October 11-14 and 21-23). We arrived before 9:00 am after our flight from NYC and the room was ready for us. The room was pink but very comfortable and clean. We loved the balcony and the 24 hour food and beverage bar was terrific. In addition to being convenient and delicious, it encourages guests to mingle and get to know each other. The desk staff was friendly and welcoming. The decore is kitschy but our room had everything we needed. The location amazing and we felt safe and very well cared for. If you are looking for an ultra-modern hotel or an "American style" room, you might be disappointed. If you value a great location, superb service and a sense of fun - stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our last night in Spain. I think it was the scariest hotel I've ever stayed at. The rooms are very, VERY, pink, they use plastic furniture. Our room had a small window that looked directly into the room across the central shaft of the building. If there had been an emergency I'm not sure how we would have gotten out and it concerned me a bit. The buffet was not impressive. It was the lowlight of our stay in Spain. So glad it was only one night.
reviews.title: There are better options

reviews.text: Great staff, nice buffet, free wifi, comfortable beds, in the heart of the city. Our 2 night, pre-cruise stay was very pleasant. Airport pick-up was arranged through the hotel and despite being late by 1 1/2 hours (luggage issue) the driver was waiting for us with a smile, a sign, and my sister and brother-in-law. Free beer and wine greeted us as we checked in, then we were off to explore. We enjoyed our short stay, the charm of something different, and the beauty of the people.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from staying @ Continental Barcelona on October 13th, 2012.
reviews.title: Hit and Missed

reviews.text: When we got there for our pre-cruise on September 30th, Took the AeroBus #1 to the last stop and took a very short walk to the hotel, got to the hotel early morning, could not check in right the way, left the luggage with the front desk, had breakfast, went out for a walk and took a tour. Got back to the hotel late afternoon, got the Ramblas Balcony room on the 3rd floor, it was nice and clean. Love it. Went back to the buffet, took some pastas and chicken wings back to enjoy the food on our balcony, the food was good, and the Ramblas was fun.
reviews.title: Feeling at home in a great city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great, right on the Rambias. Sure rooms are small, but who is planning to spend a lot of time in a room when in Barcelona. Snack bar was great for breakfast, weak for dinner. Amazing to be able to get a beer from the bar in the afternoon. Desk folk were helpful.
reviews.title: Definitely in the middle of all the action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Continental for 3 nights before our cruise and 1 night after our cruise.
reviews.title: Pre and Post cruise stay!
What a bad hotel!!
reviews.text: We read all the reviews of the pros and cons and still chose this hotel because of location, balcony and 24 hour snack bar with wine and beer included!
We knew it would be noisy but we didn't care, we wanted the experience and really enjoyed it!
reviews.title: Coolest location in Barcelona

reviews.text: Room was all pink, furniture was plastic but covered in pink fabric, bathroom was newly remodel but shower was difficult to use, shower head came to our chest! But later we were told because it was the handicapped accessible room. So they gave us a different room on the return which also had a tub
reviews.title: Great location and 24 hour food/beverages included - but the decor...???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not realize that there are 2 Hotels of the same name , just up the street from each other. We were not on the famous Ramblas directly but just off of it , our hotel was like a mini chateau with a genial british host. we had access to both hotel buffets and drinks. small room but clean and quiet.and a stone throw to everything. great value when you trow in the meals..
reviews.title: Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This very quaint hotel is in a fantastic location. We chose a superior room for our 4 night break and were not disappointed. It's a little like a rabbit warren but we had fun exploring! The 24 hour buffet is a huge plus; it may be limited, but you can get hot and cold food - even ice cream with a choice of sauce - any time, plus beer, white and rose wine (wonder why no red??) and soft drinks, all included in the price. Our room had a small balcony overlooking La Rambla and we were able to sit 'people watching' with a glass of wine, especially on our first evening when the city was was even more hectic with a fiesta passing right below us! Very good value for money and we would certainly visit again. Don't come expecting 5* luxury and gourmet food and you'll have a great time here :-)
reviews.title: Very Happy Stay in Barcelona

reviews.text: My husband and I went to Barcelona for four days prior to taking our Carnival cruise (Breeze) July 2012. We took a cab (around 25 Euros) to the hotel. The hotel is on the third floor, so we took the elevator (there is also a hostel in the building). The people at the front desk were very nice and informative. Our room was small yet nice (we booked the room with a balcony). The snack bar was very convenient (saved us money for breakfast and snacks), The location of the hotel is in Las Ramblas and was very close to sight seeing in the Gothic quarters (La Seu Cathedral), Plaza Real, local open market with fresh fruit, places to eat, Flamenco and restaurants. The subway is a block away. We took the subway to visit La Sagrada Familia church, Casa Mila, Casa Batilo and Museo Picasso. We also went to Montserrat (we took the subway to a train -this is a whole day event, wonderful place in the mountains if you have time). On the day of our cruise, taxis were lined up in front of the hotel building and cost 25 Euros. If I go to Barcelona, I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location and snacks on Las Ramblas!

reviews.text: This hotel is Spain to me, it's a little rough around the edges, lived in, friendly and has a great location! I had breakfast every morning on a balcony overlooking one of the worlds most famous streets. It is only a short stroll to either the gothic quarter or farmers market. And the Metro entrance is right outside! Perfect.
reviews.title: This hotel has personality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelling is an adventure not a trip to the hospital. Who wants to go on vacation and spend all day in the hotel? Las Ramblas is right outside your door, of course it's a little noisy! Spain isnt some pristine, sterile modern country, it's full of people who love life and all that it entails.
reviews.title: An ideal spot!!!!!!!!!
